net.metarelate.terminology.reasoning
Class ReasonerProxy

java.lang.Object
  net.metarelate.terminology.reasoning.ReasonerProxy

public class ReasonerProxy
extends java.lang.Object

A reasoner wrapper. This class provides some reasoning services. The only public method customReason(com.hp.hpl.jena.rdf.model.Model) accepts a set of RDF statements as a parameter and enriches this set with inferred statements. This class is intended as a place holder for more complex reasoning procedures, that could be easily implemented by importing third parties libraries. The primary use of this class in the Met Office Terminology Manager Prototype is to expand an RDF representation of a terminology set provided by the d2rq system.

Author:
andreasplendiani

Method Detail

customReason

public static void customReason(com.hp.hpl.jena.rdf.model.Model unionOfAllRDFToProcess)
Accepts a set of statements and enriches it with inferred statements. Inference could follow standard axioms sets (e.g. RDFS, OWL) or it could be customize (e.g. rules). In the current implementation, this method will check for symmetric properties and "generative" properties (more info in the Met Office Terminology Manager Prototype documentation). The specification of which properties are symmetric or generative is expected to be part of the input RDF.

Parameters:
unionOfAllRDFToProcess - The RDF input, including statements on which to apply inference and (eventually) statements that specify inference features.
